title: Obat
text: Obat is a fast growing French startup in the construction sector
infoTexts: First and foremost Obat is an invoicing platform, targeted towards the French speaking world of tradies!
I started working here freelance which has advanced into a full-time role as a Full Stack developer.
PHP, Symfony, React, JavaScript, Bootstrap, Scss, jQuery

title: Plume Nomade
text: Portfolio for content writing services, built with Nuxt.js.
infoTexts: Built for a freelance content writer to help boost their online presence and generate more leads.
I designed and created the website with Nuxt.js to get the seo benefits of server-side rendering. Nuxt.js also makes it easy to spin up a project in no time!

title: Reddit FPL GW bot
text: A bot that posts to the r/FantasyPL subreddit
linkText: Check out an example post on Reddit
infoTexts: This bot will post the weekly 'How Did ___ Play? Thread - Game Week' to the r/FantasyPL subreddit. Currently deployed and will start running next season.
I built this to help the mods of the community out as they are currently having to manually post 20 teams + players every week.
Uses the FPL API for data. Built with Node.js, deployed on Digital Ocean

title: Full-Stack MERN project
text: My final project of the Treehouse TD program.
infoTexts: A full-stack application built using Mongo, Express, React and Node.
Users can view courses created by others. They can signup/signin to create, update and delete their own courses. The app makes requests to the RESTFUL API to interact with user/course data.

The project has client and server side validation, user friendly error handling and uses bcrypt to hash user passwords. With the rising popularity of dark-mode themes, I decided to go with a dark-mode style!

title: Phrase Hunter
infoTexts: Using Object-Oriented JavaScript, I created a hang-man style game where a user has 5 lives and has to guess the hidden phrase in order to win the game!
Users can either click the on-screen keyboard or simply use their keyboard to guess the letters. Hint : (Everything is retro video game themed, including the answers!)
This project was my first intro to object-oriented programming and was a great learning experience while also building a fun game.

title: Flickr Image Gallery
text: React app that uses Flickr API
infoTexts: Using React I created an application that makes a request to the Flickr API for 24 images. The response is then displayed in 24 images using the returned urls.
Users can click the buttons to display different images based on the button topic. You can also use the search bar to make a new call to the API and see those images.
This was my first experience with React and gave me a good introduction which I have continued to build on.
